text: Is the patience of the American people that long suffering? Is there no outrage left in the country?
author: Andrew Greeley

text: I've said my patience is not infinite.
author: Darrell Issa

text: True enough, nature has endowed me with a fair measure of patience and composure, yet I should be lying if I told you that, having seen the reporter off on his way to make his deadline, I fell peacefully asleep.
author: Leon Jouhaux

text: My impression is that most women public service workers have a long fuse. Precisely because they care so deeply about services, more than anyone, they still want to find a sensible and fair negotiated agreement. But their patience has run out.
author: Frances O'Grady

text: While it is true that Frank had a great sense of humor, he was also very serious about composing music. In reality there are only a handful of skilled players who can play his most complex pieces. It takes a lot of patience to learn and requires a fantastic memory.
author: Dweezil Zappa
